Detailed Description

This class is a container of a number of ParticleSystems.

The MetaParticleSystem can contain several ParticleSystem objects, allowing them to function as a single object.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef std::vector<ParticleSystemPtr> MetaParticleSystem::ParticleSystems

A collection of ParticleSystem.

void MetaParticleSystem::addSystem ( ParticleSystemPtr  system  ) 

This method adds a system to the meta system.

Parameters:
system A pointer to the system to be added.

bool MetaParticleSystem::attach ( MatrixLiaison *  pOwnWorld  )  [virtual]

This method attaches the meta particle system to the world via a matrix liason.

We give ourselves a ground specifier.

Parameters:
pOwnWorld The matrix liason that will provide our world matrix.
Returns:
true on success, false on error.

int MetaParticleSystem::capacity ( void   ) 

This method returns the meta system's particle capacity.

Returns:
int The capacity of the meta system, or the maximum number of particles that can be active.

void MetaParticleSystem::clear (  ) 

This method tells the meta particle system to remove all particles from itself.

MetaParticleSystemPtr MetaParticleSystem::clone (  )  const

This method clones a meta particle system, but does not copy the current state of the particles.

Returns:
MetaParticleSystemPtr Smart Pointer to the cloned system.

void MetaParticleSystem::detach (  )  [virtual]

This method detaches the particle system from the existing matrix liason, undoing the attach operation.

void MetaParticleSystem::draw ( const Matrix &  world,
float  lod 
)

This methods tells the particle system to draw itself.

Particles are stored in world coordinates so we do not need the attachment transform which is passed in.

Parameters:
world Unused world matrix from the parent attachment.
lod Adjusted distance from camera, for level-of-detail use.

float MetaParticleSystem::duration (  )  const

This method returns the duration of the particle system.

The duration is only valid for particle systems containing at least one sink action that specifies a maximum particle age.

Returns:
float The duration of the particle system, or -1 if the particle system has no fixed duration.

void MetaParticleSystem::enterWorld (  )  [virtual]

The method is called when the particle system has first entered the world.

Make sure to convert back to world coordinates when entering world.

ParticleSystemPtr MetaParticleSystem::getFirstSystem (  )  [inline]

ParticleSystemPtr  system

system A pointer to the system to be added.

Parameters:
file The file to the potential particle system.

void MetaParticleSystem::isStatic ( bool  s  ) 

void MetaParticleSystem::leaveWorld (  )  [virtual]

The method is called when the particle system is leaving the world.

Make sure to convert back to local coordinates when leaving world.

uint32 MetaParticleSystem::nSystems (  )  const

void MetaParticleSystem::prerequisites ( DataSectionPtr  pDS,
std::set< std::string > &  output 
) [static]

This static method returns all of the resources that will be required to create the meta particle system.

It is designed so that the resources can be loaded in the loading thread before constructing the system.

Parameters:
pDS The data section containing the meta particle system.
output The set of output resources that are prerequisites for creation of the meta particle system.

void MetaParticleSystem::removeAllSystems ( void   ) 

This method removes all systems from the meta system.

This method removes a system from the meta system.

Parameters:
system A pointer to the system to be removed.

void MetaParticleSystem::reSerialise ( DataSectionPtr  sect,
bool  load = true,
bool  transient = false 
)

This method is used internally by the editor for undo/redo.

void MetaParticleSystem::save ( const std::string &  filename,
const std::string &  directory = "particles",
bool  transient = false 
)

This method saves a meta particle system, to a given filename and base directory.

Parameters:
filename The filename for the system.
directory Base directory path, prepended to filename.
transient Whether the save operation is transient. If set the false, the full visibility bounding box is recaculated for the save - this may take a few seconds.

void MetaParticleSystem::setDoUpdate (  ) 

This method explicitly forces a meta particle system to undergo an update next tick.

Usually, particle systems are only updated when they are visible. In some cases, it is necessary or desriable to force an update even when the system is off-screen.

void MetaParticleSystem::setFirstUpdate (  ) 

This method sets the first update flag on all particle systems.

int MetaParticleSystem::size ( void   ) 

This method counts the number of particles currently active in the meta system.

Returns:
int The number of particles currently active.

This method returns the memory used by the meta particle system.

Returns:
size_t Size, in bytes, used by the meta particle system.

void MetaParticleSystem::spawn ( int  num = 1  ) 

This method spawns a number of particles on-demand.

Parameters:
num The number of particles to spawn.

This method retrieves a system by name from the meta system.

Parameters:
name Name of the requested particle system.
Returns:
